page.title: 09MELBREAK HUNT, LOWESWATER
page.content: We all like to hear songs of hunting, Of hunters and hounds that are gone, & we're all very proud of the history The la'al Melbreak pack's built upon. Since first it kicked off with John Benson, That master so true & so grand It always has ranked amongst foxhounds As one of the best in the land. So lets sing good luck to laal M'break We've followed them many a mile. For there's one day each year we all love to be there, It's New Year's Day hunt at Kirkstile. From the Park we have shifted the kennels, To just under Hobcarton Crag Where t'laal foxhounds vow death unto foxes, As soon as their laal tails can wag. Our huntsman today understands em He wears a flash waistcoat of red. But go where you can you'll find no other man Take more pride in his hounds than Dick Head.
